diary.text:
Not knowing what to do for the long weekend in April, I and my friend decided to do something to train for our upcoming Ironman Vichy triathlon race. We ended up planning for an ambitious cycling trip from London to Bruges and back to Dover with a total distance of over 320km all together. The trip spaned over 4 days, where we agreed to take a day off and be tourists for a day in Bruges.

Days before the trip, I was totally excited but was also anxious at the same time because the total distance was way above mine and my friend’s record and nor have I ever cycle anywhere in Europe before, let alone travelling to Belgium.

In the end, the trip turned out to be an absolute blast! It was very tiring indeed but worth every drop of sweat. Not only that there are roads and paths specifically for cyclists from Dunkirk straight to Bruges, but the views and the weather were perfect. Definitely a must-come-back!

diary.text:
Prior to the trip, my average long cycle sessions typically last for around 20 - 30 km and I was reluctant to take it further yet. That was when one of my friends gathered me and some other friends together for a trip to cycle in and around the Dartmoor national park.

We were very fortunate to have our friend’s uncle to kindly accommodate us at his place, as well as providing us with a generous amount of supplies and taking us around his planned cycle routes. Although, those routes were not meant to be easy at all! With challenging hills and roaring winds and even heavy rain on the 2nd day, I found that I was struggling to keep up with everyone else.

Nevertheless, I have managed to complete all the routes and break away my mental barriers with all the support from my friends and coaching from the uncle. This trip has ultimately allowed me to push my weekly long cycle distance up by more than twice and made me enjoy cycling in the way that I have never used to!
